Other Character Lines: Lines
Donkey Lines: Lines

Other Character Lines: (crying) This cage is too small.
Donkey Lines: Please, don't turn me in. I'll never be stubborn again. I can change. Please! Give me another chance!

Other Character Lines: Oh, shut up. (jerks his rope)
Donkey Lines: Oh!

Other Character Lines: No, no! I swear! Oh! He can talk! The guards grab the old woman and she struggles with them. One of her legs flies out and kicks Tinkerbell out of Peter Pan's hands, and her cage drops on Donkey's head. He gets sprinkled with fairy dust and he's able to fly.
Donkey Lines: Hey! I can fly!

Other Character Lines: He can talk!
Donkey Lines: Ha, ha! That's right, fool! Now I'm a flying, talking donkey. You might have seen a housefly, maybe even a superfly but I bet you ain't never seen a donkey fly. Ha, ha! (the pixie dust begins to wear off) Uh-oh. (he begins to sink to the ground.) He hits the ground with a thud.

Other Character Lines: Oh, really? You and what army? He looks behind the guard and the guard turns to look as well and we see that the other men have run off. The guard tucks tail and runs off. Shrek laughs and goes back about his business and begins walking back to his cottage.
Donkey Lines: Can I say something to you? Listen, you was really, really, really somethin' back here. Incredible!

Other Character Lines: Are you talkin' to...(he turns around and Donkey is gone) me? (he turns back around and Donkey is right in front of him.) Whoa!
Donkey Lines: Yes. I was talkin' to you. Can I tell you that you that you was great back here? Those guards! They thought they was all of that. Then you showed up, and bam! They was trippin' over themselves like babes in the woods. That really made me feel good to see that.

Other Character Lines: Oh, that's great. Really.
Donkey Lines: Man, it's good to be free.

Other Character Lines: Now, why don't you go celebrate your freedom with your own friends? Hmm?
Donkey Lines: But, uh, I don't have any friends. And I'm not goin' out there by myself. Hey, wait a minute! I got a great idea! I'll stick with you. You're mean, green, fightin' machine. Together we'll scare the spit out of anybody that crosses us. Shrek turns and regards Donkey for a moment before roaring very loudly.

Other Character Lines: Why are you following me?
Donkey Lines: Oh, wow! That was really scary. If you don't mind me sayin', if that don't work, your breath certainly will get the job done, 'cause you definitely need some Tic Tacs or something, 'cause you breath stinks! You almost burned the hair outta my nose, just like the time...(Shrek covers his mouth but Donkey continues to talk, so Shrek removes his hand.) ...then I ate some rotten berries. I had strong gases leaking out of my butt that day.

Other Character Lines: Stop singing! It's no wonder you don't have any friends.
Donkey Lines: I'll tell you why. (singing) 'Cause I'm all alone, There's no one here beside me, My problems have all gone, There's no one to deride me, But you gotta have faith...

Other Character Lines: Listen, little donkey. Take a look at me. What am I?
Donkey Lines: Wow. Only a true friend would be that cruelly honest.

Other Character Lines: No! I'm an ogre! You know. "Grab your torch and pitchforks." Doesn't that bother you?
Donkey Lines: (looks all the way up at Shrek) Uh ...really tall?

Other Character Lines: Really?
Donkey Lines: Nope.

Other Character Lines: Oh.
Donkey Lines: Really, really.

Other Character Lines: Uh, Shrek.
Donkey Lines: Man, I like you. What's you name?

Other Character Lines: That would be my home.
Donkey Lines: Shrek? Well, you know what I like about you, Shrek? You got that kind of I-don't-care-what-nobody-thinks-of-me thing. I like that. I respect that, Shrek. You all right. (They come over a hill and you can see Shrek's cottage.) Whoa! Look at that. Who'd want to live in place like that?

Other Character Lines: I like my privacy.
Donkey Lines: Oh! And it is lovely! Just beautiful. You know you are quite a decorator. It's amazing what you've done with such a modest budget. I like that boulder. That is a nice boulder. I guess you don't entertain much, do you?

Other Character Lines: Uh, what?
Donkey Lines: You know, I do too. That's another thing we have in common. Like I hate it when you got somebody in your face. You've trying to give them a hint, and they won't leave. There's that awkward silence. (awkward silence) Can I stay with you?

Other Character Lines: (sarcastically) Of course!
Donkey Lines: Can I stay with you, please?

Other Character Lines: No.
Donkey Lines: Really?

Other Character Lines: Okay! Okay! But one night only.
Donkey Lines: Please! I don't wanna go back there! You don't know what it's like to be considered a freak. (pause while he looks at Shrek) Well, maybe you do. But that's why we gotta stick together. You gotta let me stay! Please! Please!

Other Character Lines: What are you...? (Donkey hops up onto a chair.) No! No!
Donkey Lines: Ah! Thank you! (he runs inside the cottage)

Other Character Lines: Oh!
Donkey Lines: This is gonna be fun! We can stay up late, swappin' manly stories, and in the mornin' I'm makin' waffles.

Other Character Lines: (irritated) Outside!
Donkey Lines: Where do, uh, I sleep?

Other Character Lines: (to Donkey) I thought I told you to stay outside.
Donkey Lines: Oh, well, I guess that's cool. I mean, I don't know you, and you don't know me, so I guess outside is best, you know. Here I go. Good night. (Shrek slams the door.) (sigh) I mean, I do like the outdoors. I'm a donkey. I was born outside. I'll just be sitting by myself outside, I guess, you know. By myself, outside. I'm all alone...there's no one here beside me...

Other Character Lines: All right, get out of here. All of you, move it! Come on! Let's go! Hapaya! Hapaya! Hey! Quickly. Come on! (more dwarves run inside the house) No, no! No, no. Not there. Not there. (they shut the door on him) Oh! (turns to look at Donkey)
Donkey Lines: (from the window) I am outside. There is another noise and Shrek turns to find the person that made the noise. He sees several shadows moving. He finally turns and spots 3 blind mice on his table.

Other Character Lines: (heavy sigh) All right. Who knows where this Farquaad guy is? Everyone looks around at each other but no one answers.
Donkey Lines: Hey, don't look at me. I didn't invite them.

Other Character Lines: Does anyone else know where to find him? Anyone at all?
Donkey Lines: Oh, I do. I know where he is.

Other Character Lines: Anyone?
Donkey Lines: Me! Me!

Other Character Lines: (sigh) Okay, fine. Attention, all fairy tale things. Do not get comfortable. Your welcome is officially worn out. In fact, I'm gonna see this guy Farquaad right now and get you all off my land and back where you came from! (Pause. Then the crowd goes wild.) Oh! (to Donkey) You! You're comin' with me.
Donkey Lines: Oh! Oh, pick me! Oh, I know! I know! Me, me!

Other Character Lines: What did I say about singing?
Donkey Lines: All right, that's what I like to hear, man. Shrek and Donkey, two stalwart friends, off on a whirlwind big-city adventure. I love it!

Other Character Lines: No.
Donkey Lines: (singing) On the road again. Sing it with me, Shrek. I can't wait to get on the road again.

Other Character Lines: Silence! I will make this Princess Fiona my queen, and DuLoc will finally have the perfect king! Captain, assemble your finest men. We're going to have a tournament. (smiles evilly) DuLoc Parking Lot - Lancelot Section Shrek and Donkey come out of the field that is right by the parking lot. The castle itself is about 40 stories high.
Donkey Lines: Can I whistle?

Other Character Lines: So, that must be Lord Farquaad's castle.
Donkey Lines: Can I hum it?

Other Character Lines: Do you think maybe he's compensating for something? (He laughs, but then groans as Donkey doesn't get the joke. He continues walking through the parking lot.)
Donkey Lines: But that's it. That's it right there. That's DuLoc. I told ya I'd find it.

Other Character Lines: It's quiet. Too quiet. Where is everybody?
Donkey Lines: Uh-huh. That's the place.

Other Character Lines: Welcome to DuLoc such a perfect town Here we have some rules Let us lay them down Don't make waves, stay in line And we'll get along fine DuLoc is perfect place Please keep off of the grass Shine your shoes, wipe your... face DuLoc is, DuLoc is DuLoc is perfect place. Suddenly a camera takes Donkey and Shrek's picture.
Donkey Lines: Hey, wait. Wait up, Shrek.

Other Character Lines: All right. You're going the right way for a smacked bottom.
Donkey Lines: Hey, look at this! Donkey runs over and pulls a lever that is attached to a box marked 'Information'. The music winds up and then the box doors open up. There are little wooden people inside and they begin to sing.

Other Character Lines: No? All right then. (drinks the beer) Come on! He takes the mug and smashes the spigot off the large barrel of beer behind him. The beer comes rushing out drenching the other men and wetting the ground. It's like mud now. Shrek slides past the men and picks up a spear that one of the men dropped. As Shrek begins to fight Donkey hops up onto one of the larger beer barrels. It breaks free of it's ropes and begins to roll. Donkey manages to squish two men into the mud. There is so much fighting going on here I'm not going to go into detail. Suffice to say that Shrek kicks butt.
Donkey Lines: Wow! Let's do that again! (makes ready to run over and pull the lever again)

Other Character Lines: What kind of quest? Time Lapse - Donkey and Shrek are now walking through the field heading away from DuLoc. Shrek is munching on an onion.
Donkey Lines: Sorry about that.

Other Character Lines: You know, maybe there's a good reason donkeys shouldn't talk.
Donkey Lines: Hey, Shrek, tag me! Tag me! Shrek comes over and bangs a man's head up against Donkeys. Shrek gets up on the ropes and interacts with the crowd.

Other Character Lines: Oh, I know what. Maybe I could have decapitated an entire village and put their heads on a pike, gotten a knife, cut open their spleen and drink their fluids. Does that sound good to you?
Donkey Lines: Let me get this straight. You're gonna go fight a dragon and rescue a princess just so Farquaad will give you back a swamp which you only don't have because he filled it full of freaks in the first place. Is that about right?

Other Character Lines: For your information, there's a lot more to ogres than people think.
Donkey Lines: I don't get it. Why don't you just pull some of that ogre stuff on him? Throttle him, lay siege to his fortress, grinds his bones to make your bread, the whole ogre trip.

Other Character Lines: Example? Okay, um, ogres are like onions. (he holds out his onion)
Donkey Lines: Uh, no, not really, no.

Other Character Lines: Yes - - No!
Donkey Lines: Example?

Other Character Lines: No!
Donkey Lines: (sniffs the onion) They stink?

Other Character Lines: No! Layers! Onions have layers. Ogres have layers! Onions have layers. You get it? We both have layers. (he heaves a sigh and then walks off)
Donkey Lines: They make you cry?

Other Character Lines: I don't care... what everyone likes. Ogres are not like cakes.
Donkey Lines: You leave them in the sun, they get all brown, start sproutin' little white hairs.

Other Character Lines: No! You dense, irritating, miniature beast of burden! Ogres are like onions! And of story. Bye-bye. See ya later.
Donkey Lines: (trailing after Shrek) Oh, you both have layers. Oh. {Sniffs} You know, not everybody likes onions. Cake! Everybody loves cakes! Cakes have layers.

Other Character Lines: You know, I think I preferred your humming.
Donkey Lines: You know what else everybody likes? Parfaits. Have you ever met a person, you say, "Let's get some parfait," they say, "Hell no, I don't like no parfait"? Parfaits are delicious.

Other Character Lines: Shrek and Donkey are walking up to the keep that's supposed to house Princess Fiona. It appears to look like a giant volcano.
Donkey Lines: Parfaits may be the most delicious thing on the whole damn planet.

Other Character Lines: Believe me, Donkey, if it was me, you'd be dead. (sniffs) It's brimstone. We must be getting close.
Donkey Lines: Do you have a tissue or something? I'm making a mess. Just the word parfait make me start slobbering. They head off. There is a montage of their journey. Walking through a field at sunset. Sleeping beneath a bright moon. Shrek trying to put the campfire out the next day and having a bit of a problem, so Donkey pees on the fire to put it out.

Other Character Lines: Sure, it's big enough, but look at the location. (laughs...then the laugh turns into a groan)
Donkey Lines: (sniffs) Ohh! Shrek! Did you do that? You gotta warn somebody before you just crack one off. My mouth was open and everything.

Other Character Lines: Oh, aye.
Donkey Lines: Yeah, right, brimstone. Don't be talking about it's the brimstone. I know what I smell. It wasn't no brimstone. It didn't come off no stone neither. They climb up the side of the volcano/keep and look down. There is a small piece of rock right in the center and that is where the castle is. It is surrounded by boiling lava. It looks very foreboding.

Other Character Lines: Wait a second. Donkeys don't have sleeves.
Donkey Lines: Uh, Shrek? Uh, remember when you said ogres have layers?

Other Character Lines: You can't tell me you're afraid of heights.
Donkey Lines: Well, I have a bit of a confession to make. Donkeys don't have layers. We wear our fear right out there on our sleeves.

Other Character Lines: Come on, Donkey. I'm right here beside ya, okay? For emotional support., we'll just tackle this thing together one little baby step at a time.
Donkey Lines: You know what I mean.

Other Character Lines: Really, really.
Donkey Lines: No, I'm just a little uncomfortable about being on a rickety bridge over a boiling like of lava!

Other Character Lines: Just keep moving. And don't look down.
Donkey Lines: Really?

Other Character Lines: But you're already halfway.
Donkey Lines: Okay, that makes me feel so much better.

Other Character Lines: Okay, fine. I don't have time for this. You go back.
Donkey Lines: Okay, don't look down. Don't look down. Don't look down. Keep on moving. Don't look down. (he steps through a rotting board and ends up looking straight down into the lava) Shrek! I'm lookin' down! Oh, God, I can't do this! Just let me off, please!

Other Character Lines: Just, Donkey - - Let's have a dance then, shall me? (bounces and sways the bridge)
Donkey Lines: But I know that half is safe!

Other Character Lines: Oh, I'm sorry. Do what? Oh, this? (bounces the bridge again)
Donkey Lines: Shrek, no! Wait!

Other Character Lines: Yes? Yes, do it. Okay. (continues to bounce and sway as he backs Donkey across the bridge)
Donkey Lines: Don't do that!

Other Character Lines: You said do it! I'm doin' it.
Donkey Lines: Yes, that!

Other Character Lines: That'll do, Donkey. That'll do. (walks towards the castle)
Donkey Lines: No, Shrek! No! Stop it!

Other Character Lines: Inside, waiting for us to rescue her. (chuckles)
Donkey Lines: I'm gonna die. I'm gonna die. Shrek, I'm gonna die. (steps onto solid ground) Oh!
Cool. So where is this fire-breathing pain-in-the-neck anyway?

Other Character Lines: No.
Donkey Lines: I was talkin' about the dragon, Shrek.

Other Character Lines: Shh.
Donkey Lines: You afraid?

Other Character Lines: Donkey, two things, okay? Shut ... up. Now go over there and see if you can find any stairs.
Donkey Lines: But...

Other Character Lines: (putting on a helmet) The princess will be up the stairs in the highest room in the tallest tower.
Donkey Lines: Oh, good. Me neither. (sees a skeleton and gasps) 'Cause there's nothin' wrong with bein' afraid. Fear's a sensible response to an unfamiliar situation. Unfamiliar dangerous situation, I might add. With a dragon that breathes fire and eats knights and breathes fire, it sure doesn't mean you're a coward if you're a little scared. I sure as heck ain't no coward. I know that.

Other Character Lines: I read it in a book once. (walks off)
Donkey Lines: Stairs? I thought we was lookin' for the princess.

Other Character Lines: Donkey is still talking to himself as he looks around the room.
Donkey Lines: What makes you think she'll be there?

Other Character Lines: Well, at least we know where the princess is, but where's the...
Donkey Lines: Cool. You handle the dragon. I'll handle the stairs. I'll find those stairs. I'll whip their butt too. Those stairs won't know which way they're goin'. (walks off)

Other Character Lines: Donkey, look out! (he manages to get a hold of the dragons tail and holds on) Got ya! The dragon gets irritated at this and flicks it's tail and Shrek goes flying through the air and crashes through the roof of the tallest tower. Fiona wakes up with a jerk and looks at him lying on the floor.
Donkey Lines: I'm gonna take drastic steps. Kick it to the curb. Don't mess with me. I'm the stair master. I've mastered the stairs. I wish I had a step right here. I'd step all over it.

Other Character Lines: One of a kind. (opens the door into the throne room)
Donkey Lines: (os) Dragon! Donkey gasps and takes off running as the dragon roars again. Shrek manages to grab Donkey out of the way just as the dragon breathes fire.

Other Character Lines: (sliding down the 'volcano' hill) You did it! You rescued me! You're amazing. (behind her Donkey falls down the hill) You're - - You're wonderful. You're... (turns and sees Shrek fall down the hill and bump into Donkey) a little unorthodox I'll admit. But thy deed is great, and thy heart is pure. I am eternally in your debt. (Donkey clears his throat.) And where would a brave knight be without his noble steed?
Donkey Lines: Oh! Aah! Aah! Donkey get cornered as the Dragon knocks away all but a small part of the bridge he's on.

Other Character Lines: What? (to Donkey) That wasn't in the job description.
Donkey Lines: No. Oh, no, No! (the dragon roars) Oh, what large teeth you have. (the dragon growls) I mean white, sparkling teeth. I know you probably hear this all time from your food, but you must bleach, 'cause that is one dazzling smile you got there. Do I detect a hint of minty freshness? And you know what else? You're - - You're a girl dragon! Oh, sure! I mean, of course you're a girl dragon. You're just reeking of feminine beauty. (the dragon begins fluttering her eyes at him) What's the matter with you? You got something in your eye? Ohh. Oh. Oh. Man, I'd really love to stay, but you know, I'm, uh...(the dragon blows a smoke ring in the shape of a heart right at him, and he coughs) I'm an asthmatic, and I don't know if it'd work out if you're gonna blow smoke rings. Shrek! (the dragon picks him up with her teeth and carries him off) No! Shrek! Shrek! Shrek!

Other Character Lines: No, it's destiny. Oh, you must know how it goes. A princess locked in a tower and beset by a dragon is rescued by a brave knight, and then they share true love's first kiss.
Donkey Lines: (os) Slow down. Slow down, baby, please. I believe it's healthy to get to know someone over a long period of time. Just call me old-fashioned. (laughs worriedly) (we see him up close and from a distance as Shrek sneaks into the room) I don't want to rush into a physical relationship. I'm not emotionally ready for a commitment of, uh, this - - Magnitude really is the word I'm looking for. Magnitude- - Hey, that is unwanted physical contact. Hey, what are you doing? Okay, okay. Let's just back up a little and take this one step at a time. We really should get to know each other first as friends or pen pals. I'm on the road a lot, but I just love receiving cards - - I'd really love to stay, but - - Don't do that! That's my tail! That's my personal tail. You're gonna tear it off. I don't give permission - - What are you gonna do with that? Hey, now. No way. No! No! No, no! No. No, no, no. No! Oh! Shrek grabs a chain that's connected to the chandelier and swings toward the dragon. He misses and he swings back again. He looks up and spots that the chandelier is right above the dragons head. He pulls on the chain and it releases and he falls down and bumps Donkey out of the way right as the dragon is about to kiss him. Instead the dragon kisses Shreks' butt. She opens her eyes and roars. Shrek lets go of the chain and the chandelier falls onto her head, but it's too big and it goes over her head and forms a sort of collar for her. She roars again and Shrek and Donkey take off running. Very 'Matrix' style. Shrek grabs Donkey and then grabs Princess Fiona as he runs past her.

Other Character Lines: Well, yes. Both Donkey and Shrek burst out laughing.
Donkey Lines: Hi, Princess!

Other Character Lines: But I have to be rescued by my true love, not by some ogre and his- - his pet.
Donkey Lines: I hope you heard that. She called me a noble steed. She think I'm a steed.

Other Character Lines: Ya comin', Donkey?
Donkey Lines: Maybe it's a perk.

Other Character Lines: A little time has passed and Fiona has calmed down. She just hangs there limply while Shrek carries her.
Donkey Lines: Hmm? With Shrek? You think- - Wait. Wait. You think that Shrek is you true love?

Other Character Lines: You just tell her she's not your true love. Everyone knows what happens when you find your...(Shrek drops her on the ground) Hey! The sooner we get to DuLoc the better.
Donkey Lines: You think Shrek is your true love!

Other Character Lines: Let me put it this way, Princess. Men of Farquaad's stature are in short supply. (he and Donkey laugh) Shrek then proceeds to splash water onto his face to wash off the dust and grime.
Donkey Lines: Well, so much for noble steed.

Other Character Lines: But there's robbers in the woods.
Donkey Lines: I'm right behind ya.

Other Character Lines: Hey! Over here.
Donkey Lines: Okay, so here's another question. Say there's a woman that digs you, right, but you don't really like her that way. How do you let her down real easy so her feelings aren't hurt, but you don't get burned to a crisp and eaten?

Other Character Lines: A door? Well, gentlemen, I bid thee good night. (goes into the cave and puts the bark door up behind her)
Donkey Lines: You're gonna love it there, Princess. It's beautiful!

Other Character Lines: (os) I said good night! Shrek looks at Donkey for a second and then goes to move the boulder back in front of the entrance to the cave with Fiona still inside.
Donkey Lines: I don't know. There are those who think little of him. (they laugh again) Fiona: Stop it. Stop it, both of you. You're just jealous you can never measure up to a great ruler like Lord Farquaad.

Other Character Lines: And, uh, that one, that's Throwback, the only ogre to ever spit over three wheat fields.
Donkey Lines: Whoa! Time out, Shrek! Camp is starting to sound good.

Other Character Lines: The stars don't tell the future, Donkey. They tell stories. Look, there's Bloodnut, the Flatulent. You can guess what he's famous for.
Donkey Lines: Shrek, we can do better than that. I don't think this is fit for a princess.

Other Character Lines: No, look. There he is, and there's the group of hunters running away from his stench.
Donkey Lines: You want me to read you a bedtime story? I will.

Other Character Lines: You know, Donkey, sometimes things are more than they appear. Hmm? Forget it.
Donkey Lines: Shrek, What are you doing?

Other Character Lines: Our swamp?
Donkey Lines: Right. Yeah. Hey, can you tell my future from these stars?

Other Character Lines: We? Donkey, there's no "we". There's no "our". There's just me and my swamp. The first thing I'm gonna do is build a ten-foot wall around my land.
Donkey Lines: I know you're making this up.

Other Character Lines: No, do ya think?
Donkey Lines: That ain't nothin' but a bunch of little dots.

Other Character Lines: Never mind, Donkey.
Donkey Lines: (heaves a big sigh) Hey, Shrek, what we gonna do when we get our swamp anyway?

Other Character Lines: No, this is one of those drop-it and leave-it alone things.
Donkey Lines: You know, when we're through rescuing the princess.

Other Character Lines: Why do you want to talk about it?
Donkey Lines: You cut me deep, Shrek. You cut me real deep just now. You know what I think? I think this whole wall thing is just a way to keep somebody out.

Other Character Lines: I'm not blocking.
Donkey Lines: Are you hidin' something?

Other Character Lines: Donkey, I'm warning you.
Donkey Lines: Oh, this is another one of those onion things, isn't it?

Other Character Lines: Everyone! Okay?
Donkey Lines: Why don't you want to talk about it?

Other Character Lines: Oh! For the love of Pete! (gets up and walks over to the edge of the cliff and sits down)
Donkey Lines: Why are you blocking?

Other Character Lines: Look, I'm not the one with the problem, okay? It's the world that seems to have a problem with me. People take one look at me and go. "Aah! Help! Run! A big, stupid, ugly ogre!" They judge me before they even know me. That's why I'm better off alone.
Donkey Lines: Oh, yes, you are.

Other Character Lines: Yeah, I know.
Donkey Lines: Who you trying to keep out?

Other Character Lines: Well, there's, um, Gabby, the Small and Annoying.
Donkey Lines: (pause) Oh, now we're gettin' somewhere. (grins) At this point Fiona pulls the 'door' away from the entrance to the cave and peaks out. Neither of the guys see her.

Other Character Lines: That's the moon.
Donkey Lines: What's your problem? What you got against the whole world anyway?

Other Character Lines: Fiona walks out of the cave. She glances at Shrek and Donkey who are still sleeping. She wanders off into the woods and comes across a blue bird. She begins to sing. The bird sings along with her. She hits higher and higher notes and the bird struggles to keep up with her. Suddenly the pressure of the note is too big and the bird explodes. Fiona looks a little sheepish, but she eyes the eggs that the bird left behind. Time lapse, Fiona is now cooking the eggs for breakfast. Shrek and Donkey are still sleeping. Shrek wakes up and looks at Fiona. Donkey's talking in his sleep.
Donkey Lines: You know what? When we met, I didn't think you was just a big, stupid, ugly ogre.

Other Character Lines: Donkey, wake up. (shakes him)
Donkey Lines: So, uh, are there any donkeys up there?

Other Character Lines: Wake up.
Donkey Lines: Okay, okay, I see it now. The big shiny one, right there. That one there? Fiona puts the door back.

Other Character Lines: Good morning. Hm, how do you like your eggs?
Donkey Lines: Oh, okay. DuLoc - Farquaad's Bedroom The camera pans over a lot of wedding stuff. Soft music plays in the background. Farquaad is in bed, watching as the Magic Mirror shows him Princess Fiona.

Other Character Lines: They are once again on their way. They are walking through the forest. Shrek belches.
Donkey Lines: (quietly) Mmm, yeah, you know I like it like that. Come on, baby. I said I like it.

Other Character Lines: What? It's a compliment. Better out than in, I always say. (laughs)
Donkey Lines: Huh? What?

Other Character Lines: Thanks.
Donkey Lines: What? (stretches and yawns)

Other Character Lines: Oh, no. This is all my fault. I'm so sorry.
Donkey Lines: Oh, good morning, Princess! Fiona gets up and sets the eggs down in front of them.

Other Character Lines: Shrek's hurt.
Donkey Lines: Shrek!

Other Character Lines: Donkey, I'm okay.
Donkey Lines: Well, it's no way to behave in front of a princess. Fiona belches

Other Character Lines: Donkey! Calm down. If you want to help Shrek, run into the woods and find me a blue flower with red thorns.
Donkey Lines: She's as nasty as you are.

Other Character Lines: Donkey!
Donkey Lines: (walking up) Why? What's wrong?

Other Character Lines: Donkey is still looking for the special flower.
Donkey Lines: Shrek's hurt. Shrek's hurt? Oh, no, Shrek's gonna die.

Other Character Lines: (os) Ow!
Donkey Lines: You can't do this to me, Shrek. I'm too young for you to die. Keep you legs elevated. Turn your head and cough. Does anyone know the Heimlich?

Other Character Lines: Ow! Ohh! (he jerks and manages to fall over with Fiona on top of him)
Donkey Lines: Blue flower, red thorns. Okay, I'm on it. Blue flower, red thorns. Don't die Shrek. If you see a long tunnel, stay away from the light!

Other Character Lines: (throwing Fiona off of him) Nothing happend. We were just, uh - -
Donkey Lines: Oh, yeah. Right. Blue flower, red thorns. (runs off)

Other Character Lines: Oh, come on! That's the last thing on my mind. The princess here was just- - (Fiona pulls the arrow out) Ugh! (he turns to look at Fiona who holds up the arrow with a smile) Ow!
Donkey Lines: Blue flower, red thorns. Blue flower, red thorns. Blue flower, red thorns. This would be so much easier if I wasn't color-blind! Blue flower, red thorns.

Other Character Lines: That's DuLoc?
Donkey Lines: Hold on, Shrek! I'm comin'! (rips a flower off a nearby bush that just happens to be a blue flower with red thorns)

Other Character Lines: I mean, look at him. He doesn't look so good.
Donkey Lines: Ahem.

Other Character Lines: Uh, you know, I'll make you some tea.
Donkey Lines: Look, if you wanted to be alone, all you had to do was ask. Okay?

Other Character Lines: I'll get the firewood.
Donkey Lines: Hey, what's that? (nervous chuckle) That's...is that blood? Donkey faints. Shrek walks over and picks him up as they continue on their way. There is a montage of scenes as the group heads back to DuLoc. Shrek crawling up to the top of a tree to make it fall over a small brook so that Fiona won't get wet. Shrek then gets up as Donkey is just about to cross the tree and the tree swings back into it's upright position and Donkey flies off. Shrek swatting and a bunch of flies and mosquitoes. Fiona grabs a nearby spiderweb that's on a tree branch and runs through the field swinging it around to catch the bugs. She then hands it to Shrek who begins eating like it's a treat. As he walks off she licks her fingers. Shrek catching a toad and blowing it up like a balloon and presenting it to Fiona. Fiona catching a snake, blowing it up, fashioning it into a balloon animal and presenting it to Shrek. The group arriving at a windmill that is near DuLoc.

Other Character Lines: I, um, I was wondering...are you...(sighs) Are you gonna eat that?
Donkey Lines: Yeah, I know. You know, Shrek thinks Lord Farquaad's compensating for something, which I think means he has a really...(Shrek steps on his hoof) Ow!

Other Character Lines: What?
Donkey Lines: What are you talking about? I'm fine.

Other Character Lines: Yes! Yes, that's it. I'm terrified. You know, I'd better go inside.
Donkey Lines: I didn't want to say nothin', but I got this twinge in my neck, and when I turn my head like this, look, (turns his neck in a very sharp way until his head is completely sideways) Ow! See?

Other Character Lines: Good night. Fiona goes inside the windmill and closes the door. Donkey looks at Shrek with a new eye.
Donkey Lines: Hey, where you goin'? Oh, man, I can't feel my toes! (looks down and yelps) I don't have any toes! I think I need a hug.

Other Character Lines: Oh, what are you talkin' about?
Donkey Lines: (chuckles) Man, isn't this romantic? Just look at that sunset.

Other Character Lines: You're crazy. I'm just bringing her back to Farquaad.
Donkey Lines: Wait a minute. I see what's goin' on here. You're afraid of the dark, aren't you?

Other Character Lines: I- - There's nothing to tell. Besides, even if I did tell her that, well, you know - - and I'm not sayin' I do 'cause I don't - - she's a princess, and I'm - -
Donkey Lines: Don't feel bad, Princess. I used to be afraid of the dark, too, until - - Hey, no, wait. I'm still afraid of the dark. Shrek sighs

Other Character Lines: Yeah. An ogre.
Donkey Lines: Ohh! Now I really see what's goin' on here.

Other Character Lines: Donkey opens the door to the Windmill and walks in. Fiona is nowhere to be seen.
Donkey Lines: I don't even wanna hear it. Look, I'm an animal, and I got instincts. And I know you two were diggin' on each other. I could feel it.

Other Character Lines: Oh, no!
Donkey Lines: Oh, come on, Shrek. Wake up and smell the pheromones. Just go on in and tell her how you feel.

Other Character Lines: Shh!
Donkey Lines: An ogre?

Other Character Lines: No, it's okay. It's okay.
Donkey Lines: Hey, where you goin'?

Other Character Lines: Donkey, I'm the princess.
Donkey Lines: Princess? Princess Fiona? Princess, where are you? Princess? Fiona looks at Donkey from the shadows, but we can't see her.

Other Character Lines: It's me, in this body.
Donkey Lines: It's very spooky in here. I ain't playing no games. Suddenly Fiona falls from the railing. She gets up only she doesn't look like herself. She looks like an ogre and Donkey starts freaking out.

Other Character Lines: Donkey!
Donkey Lines: Aah!

Other Character Lines: No!
Donkey Lines: No, help!

Other Character Lines: Shh.
Donkey Lines: Shrek! Shrek! Shrek!

Other Character Lines: This is me. Donkey looks into her eyes as she pets his muzzle, and he quiets down.
Donkey Lines: What did you do with the princess?

Other Character Lines: I'm ugly, okay?
Donkey Lines: Aah!

Other Character Lines: No. I - - I've been this way as long as I can remember.
Donkey Lines: Oh, my God! You ate the princess. (to her stomach) Can you hear me?

Other Character Lines: It only happens when sun goes down. "By night one way, by day another. This shall be the norm... until you find true love's first kiss... and then take love's true form."
Donkey Lines: (still aimed at her stomach) Listen, keep breathing! I'll get you out of there!

Other Character Lines: It's a spell. (sigh) When I was a little girl, a witch cast a spell on me. Every night I become this. This horrible, ugly beast! I was placed in a tower to await the day my true love would rescue me. That's why I have to marry Lord Farquaad tomorrow before the sun sets and he sees me like this. (begins to cry)
Donkey Lines: Shrek! Shrek! Shrek!

Other Character Lines: But Donkey, I'm a princess, and this is not how a princess is meant to look.
Donkey Lines: Shrek!

Other Character Lines: I have to. Only my true love's kiss can break the spell.
Donkey Lines: Princess? What happened to you? You're, uh, uh, uh, different.

Other Character Lines: Don't you see, Donkey? That's just how it has to be. It's the only way to break the spell.
Donkey Lines: Well, yeah! Was it something you ate? 'Cause I told Shrek those rats was a bad idea. You are what you eat, I said. Now - -

Other Character Lines: No! You can't breathe a word. No one must ever know.
Donkey Lines: What do you mean? Look, I ain't never seen you like this before.

Other Character Lines: Promise you won't tell. Promise!
Donkey Lines: Ah, that's beautiful. I didn't know you wrote poetry.

Other Character Lines: Yeah? Well, it does. (Fiona looks at him in shock. He looks past her and spots a group approaching.) Ah, right on time. Princess, I've brought you a little something. Farquaad has arrived with a group of his men. He looks very regal sitting up on his horse. You would never guess that he's only like 3 feet tall. Donkey wakes up with a yawn as the soldiers march by.
Donkey Lines: All right, all right. Calm down. Look, it's not that bad. You're not that ugly. Well, I ain't gonna lie. You are ugly. But you only look like this at night. Shrek's ugly 24-7.

Other Character Lines: Fare-thee-well, ogre. Farquaad's whole party begins to head back to DuLoc. Donkey watches them go.
Donkey Lines: Princess, how 'bout if you don't marry Farquaad?

Other Character Lines: Yeah? So what?
Donkey Lines: But, you know, um, you're kind of an orge, and Shrek - - well, you got a lot in common.

Other Character Lines: I know you talked to her last night. You're great pals, aren't ya? Now, if you two are such good friends, why don't you follow her home?
Donkey Lines: You at least gotta tell Shrek the truth.

Other Character Lines: I told you, didn't I? You're not coming home with me. I live alone! My swamp! Me! Nobody else! Understand? Nobody! Especially useless, pathetic, annoying, talking donkeys!
Donkey Lines: What's the point of being able to talk if you gotta keep secrets?

Other Character Lines: Yeah. You know what? You thought wrong! (stomps off)
Donkey Lines: All right, all right. I won't tell him. But you should. (goes outside) I just know before this is over, I'm gonna need a whole lot of serious therapy. Look at my eye twitchin'. Fiona comes out the door and watches him walk away. She looks down and spots the sunflower. She picks it up before going back inside the windmill.

Other Character Lines: Donkey? (Donkey ignores him and continues with what he's doing.) What are you doing?
Donkey Lines: What'd I miss? What'd I miss? (spots the soldiers) (muffled) Who said that? Couldn't have been the donkey.

Other Character Lines: Well, yeah. But the wall's supposed to go around my swamp, not through it.
Donkey Lines: Shrek, what are you doing? You're letting her get away.

Other Character Lines: Oh! Your half. Hmm.
Donkey Lines: Shrek, there's something about her you don't know. Look, I talked to her last night, She's - -

Other Character Lines: Back off!
Donkey Lines: Shrek, I - - I wanna go with you.

Other Character Lines: This is my swamp!
Donkey Lines: But I thought - -

Other Character Lines: (grabs the tree branch Donkey is working with) Let go, Donkey!
Donkey Lines: Shrek. Montage of different scenes. Shrek arriving back home. Fiona being fitted for the wedding dress. Donkey at a stream running into the dragon. Shrek cleaning up his house. Fiona eating dinner alone. Shrek eating dinner alone.

Other Character Lines: Stubborn jackass!
Donkey Lines: I would think, of all people, you would recognize a wall when you see one.

Other Character Lines: Fine! (drops the tree branch and walks away)
Donkey Lines: It is around your half. See that's your half, and this is my half.

Other Character Lines: Well, I'm through with you.
Donkey Lines: Yes, my half. I helped rescue the princess. I did half the work. I get half the booty. Now hand me that big old rock, the one that looks like your head.

Other Character Lines: Oh, yeah? Well, if I treated you so bad, how come you came back?
Donkey Lines: No, you back off.

Other Character Lines: Oh, yeah. You're right, Donkey. I forgive you... for stabbin' me in the back! (goes into the outhouse and slams the door)
Donkey Lines: Our swamp.

Other Character Lines: (os) Go away!
Donkey Lines: You let go.

Other Character Lines: (os) Love me? She said I was ugly, a hideous creature. I heard the two of you talking.
Donkey Lines: Smelly ogre.

Other Character Lines: (opens the door and comes out) She wasn't talking about me? Well, then who was she talking about?
Donkey Lines: Hey, hey, come back here. I'm not through with you yet.

Other Character Lines: Donkey!
Donkey Lines: Uh-uh. You know, with you it's always, "Me, me, me!" Well, guess what! Now it's my turn! So you just shut up and pay attention! You are mean to me. You insult me and you don't appreciate anything that I do! You're always pushing me around or pushing me away.

Other Character Lines: Okay, look. I'm sorry, all right? (sigh) I'm sorry. I guess I am just a big, stupid, ugly ogre. Can you forgive me?
Donkey Lines: Because that's what friends do! They forgive each other!

Other Character Lines: Right. Friends?
Donkey Lines: Ohh! You're so wrapped up in layers, onion boy, you're afraid of your own feelings.

Other Character Lines: So, um, what did Fiona say about me?
Donkey Lines: There you are , doing it again just like you did to Fiona. All she ever do was like you, maybe even love you.

Other Character Lines: The wedding! We'll never make it in time.
Donkey Lines: She wasn't talkin' about you. She was talkin' about, uh, somebody else.

Other Character Lines: Donkey?
Donkey Lines: Uh-uh, no way. I ain't saying anything. You don't wanna listen to me. Right? Right?

Other Character Lines: Aw, come here, you. (gives Donkey a noogie)
Donkey Lines: No!

Other Character Lines: Some guards are milling around. Suddenly the dragon lands with a boom. The guards all take off running.
Donkey Lines: Hey, that's what friends are for, right?

Other Character Lines: (at the Church door) What are you talking about?
Donkey Lines: Friends.

Other Character Lines: I don't have time for this!
Donkey Lines: What are you asking me for? Why don't you just go ask her?

Other Character Lines: Yes.
Donkey Lines: Ha-ha-ha! Never fear, for where, there's a will, there's a way and I have a way. (whistles) Suddenly the dragon arrives overhead and flies low enough so they can climb on.

Other Character Lines: Yes.
Donkey Lines: I guess it's just my animal magnetism. They both laugh.

Other Character Lines: Yes!
Donkey Lines: All right, all right. Don't get all slobbery. No one likes a kiss ass. All right, hop on and hold on tight. I haven't had a chance to install the seat belts yet. They climb aboard the dragon and she takes off for DuLoc.

Other Character Lines: All right! Cut it out. When does this guy say the line?
Donkey Lines: (to Dragon) Go ahead, HAVE SOME FUN. If we need you, I'll whistle. How about that? (she nods and goes after the guards) Shrek, wait, wait! Wait a minute! You wanna do this right, don't you?

Other Character Lines: What do you see?
Donkey Lines: There's a line you gotta wait for. The preacher's gonna say, "Speak now or forever hold your peace." That's when you say, "I object!"

Other Character Lines: I now pronounce you husband and wife... Outside
Donkey Lines: Hey, wait. What are you doing? Listen to me! Look, you love this woman, don't you?

Other Character Lines: ...king and queen. Outside
Donkey Lines: You wanna hold her?

Other Character Lines: I will have order! I will have perfection! I will have - - (Donkey and the dragon show up and the dragon leans down and eats Farquaad) Aaaah! Aah!
Donkey Lines: Please her?

Other Character Lines: But you ARE beautiful. They smile at each other.
Donkey Lines: (singing James Brown style) Then you got to, got to try a little tenderness. (normal) The chicks love that romantic crap!

Other Character Lines: God bless us, every one.
Donkey Lines: We gotta check it out.
The whole town's in there. Inside
They're at the altar. Inside
Mother Fletcher! He already said it.

All right. Nobody move. I got a dragon here, and I'm not afraid to use it. (The dragon roars.) I'm a donkey on the edge! The dragon belches and Farquaad's crown flies out of her mouth and falls to the ground.
Celebrity marriages. They never last, do they? The congregation cheers.
Go ahead, Shrek.
(chuckles) I was hoping this would be a happy ending. Shrek and Fiona kiss...and the kiss fades into...
(as he's done singing and we fade to black) Oh, that's funny. Oh. Oh. I can't breathe. I can't breathe.
